items.name: AimPunchProfile
items.summary: A settings profile for an aim punch effect.

items.name: strength
items.summary:
The strength of the aim punch. The higher the value, the more the
camera will be rotated.

items.name: decayRate
items.summary:
How quickly the camera resets back to a resting position. The higher
the value, the faster the camera will reset.

items.name: directionMin
items.summary:
The minimum direction the camera moves when aim punched. A random
value between the min and max is chosen each time.

items.name: directionMax
items.summary:
The maximum direction the camera moves when aim punched. A random
value between the min and max is chosen each time.

items.name: CameraCollision
items.summary:
Adjusts the camera's position to avoid colliding with objects or
occluding the tracking target.

items.name: CameraCollisionSettings
items.summary: Settings for camera collision.

items.name: occlusionMask
items.summary:
The physics layers that are hit by the camera's raycasts, and thus
determine the objects that the camera collides/occludes with. This
generally should be the environment layer, which is usually
recommended to be the "Default" layer.

items.name: cameraRadius
items.summary:
The radius of the camera which indicates how close it can get to an
object before colliding. This is useful to prevent the camera from
clipping through objects.

items.name: smoothingIn
items.summary:
How quickly the camera changes position when collision causes the
camera to move closer to the subject. Smaller numbers make the
camera move quicker.

items.name: smoothingOut
items.summary:
How quickly the camera changes position when collision causes the
camera to move further from the subject. Smaller numbers make the
camera move quicker.

items.name: resetDelay
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes before the camera resets to its
normal position after collisions are resolved. This is useful to
prevent the camera from repositioning too often when going in and
out of collision.

items.name: minOcclusionDistance
items.summary:
The minimum occlusion distance from the camera. Sometimes you want
to leave at least a little bit of space between the camera and the
character while occluding.

in occlusion and the min and max distance (Read only).

items.name: distanceOffset
items.summary:

factoring in occlusion and the min and max distance (Read only).

items.name: maxDistance

items.name: pivotDistance
items.summary: The intended distance between the camera and the pivot point.

items.name: SetDistance(Single)
items.summary:
Sets the zoom distance to the given value. The distance will be
clamped within the zoom range.

parameters.description: The camera zoom distance.

items.name: ResetDistance()
items.summary: Resets the zoom percentage to the initial distance.

items.name: ZoomSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera zoom behavior.

items.name: inputAxis
items.summary: The input axis to change the camera zoom.

items.name: distanceRange
items.summary:
The minimum and maximum distance of the camera from the pivot point.
Set the min and max to the same value for a fixed zoom distance.

items.name: initialDistance
items.summary: The initial distance of the camera from the pivot point.

items.name: smoothing
items.summary:
How quickly the camera zoom changes to the intended distance. Larger
numbers make the camera zoom more smoothly.

items.name: transitionDuration
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes to transition zoom distance when the
camera profile is changed. For example, this is used when
transitioning from first-person to third-person, or vice versa.

items.name: increment
items.summary: Aligns the camera zoom to set increments.

items.name: AimPunch
items.summary:
Quickly "punches" the camera's rotation in one direction then resets to
the resting position. This is often used to indicate the player was hit
by an object or attack.

syntax.content: public sealed class AimPunch : CameraEffect<AimPunchSettings, AimPunchProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: CameraShake
items.summary:
Rapidly changes the position and rotation of the camera to simulate the
camera shaking.

syntax.content: public sealed class CameraShake : CameraEffect<CameraShakeSettings, CameraShakeProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: FOVKick
items.summary:
Animates a subtle change in the field of view of the camera. For
example, increasing the field of view when the player sprints creates a
better feel for the faster motion.

syntax.content: public sealed class FOVKick : CameraEffect<FOVKickSettings, FOVKickProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: ScreenFade
items.summary: Fades the screen in and out.

syntax.content: public sealed class ScreenFade : CameraEffect<ScreenFadeSettings, ScreenFadeProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: color
items.summary: The current color of the fade (Read only).
